Key Match Events: Memphis Grizzlies built a 17-point lead in the first half but allowed Utah Jazz to tie the game at 116-116 with under three minutes left.
Ja Morant and Marcus Smart made key layups in the waning moments to secure the win.
Desmond Bane hit a key 3-pointer with about six minutes left in the fourth quarter to help Memphis reestablish a five-point lead after Utah had rallied.
Utah tied it again at 116-116 on Walker Kessler’s tip-in with under three minutes remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: The Grizzlies withstood a big rally from the Jazz for a 126-124 victory in each team’s NBA season opener.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game had a high-scoring nature with both teams having key performers.
The Grizzlies turned 17 turnovers by the Jazz into 24 points and hit seven more 3-pointers (17 vs. 10).
The Jazz scored the game’s first five points on buckets by Sexton and Markkanen.
